wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
==January==
* '''[[1 January|1]]''' â€“  [[E.V. Gordon]] replaces [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] in the Chair of English Language at the University of Leeds. 
==March==
* '''?''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s "Philology: General Works" is published in ''[[The Year's Work in English Studies]]''.
==April==
* '''[[29 April|29]]''' - [[Leonard Fenton]], who would voice [[Thranduil|the Elvenking]] in the radio play of ''[[The Hobbit (1968 radio series)|The Hobbit]]'' and [[Daddy Twofoot]] in ''[[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|The Lord of the Rings]]'', is born.
==May==
* '''?''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] meets [[C.S. Lewis]], who will have a lasting impact on his works.

==June==
* '''[[25 June|25]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes a letter to W.G. Harding.

==September==
* '''[[7 September|7]]''' - [[Don Messick]], who would voice [[Balin]] and the [[Gwaihir|Lord of the Eagles]] in [[The Hobbit (1977 film)]], is born.
==October==
* '''[[21 October|21]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Willard G. Harding (21 October 1926)|a letter to Willard G. Harding]].

==December==
* '''[[26 December|26]]''' - [[Father Christmas]] writes a [[Letters from Father Christmas|letter]] to [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s children.
==?==
* '''?''' - [[The Coalbiters]] is formed, a faculty club who read Old Norse.
